meanings.definition: A formal gesture of respect or politeness, typically performed by women by bending the knees with one foot forward and the other foot back.
meanings.sent1: During the royal ball, the young princess gave a graceful curtsey to the queen.
meanings.sent2: She learned to do a curtsey in her etiquette class.
meanings.sent3: The little girl curtseyed to her teddy bear, pretending it was a queen.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's curtsey at the end of the performance was like a final bow to the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her curtsey was so elegant that it left a lasting impression on everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: To perform a curtsey as a gesture of respect or politeness.
meanings.sent1: The young girl curtseys to her ballet teacher at the end of each class.
meanings.sent2: She curtseys gracefully whenever she meets someone new.
meanings.sent3: The cat curtseys to its owner by rubbing against their legs affectionately.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the tree curtseys to the wind, swaying gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The old man curtseys to tradition by always tipping his hat when greeting someone.
